deck: The fifth Scooby-Doo TV film.
name: Scooby-Doo! in Arabian Nights

deck: Scooby-Doo's first DTV animated film.
name: Scooby-Doo on Zombie Island

deck: Scooby-Doo's second animated DTV film has the gang facing off against the evil spirit of a witch.
name: Scooby-Doo and the Witch's Ghost

deck: Scooby-Doo's third DTV animated film.
name: Scooby-Doo and the Alien Invaders

deck: Scooby-Doo's fourth animated DTV film. In the film, the Mystery Inc. gets zapped inside a computer, and must find their way out while trying to figure out who trapped them in the first place.
name: Scooby-Doo and the Cyber Chase

deck: Scooby-Doo's fifth DTV animated film.
name: Scooby-Doo! And the Legend of the Vampire

deck: Scooby-Doo's sixth DTV animated film has the Mystery Inc. investigating a Chupacabra.
name: Scooby-Doo! and the Monster of Mexico

deck: Scooby-Doo's seventh DTV animated film.
name: Scooby-Doo! and the Loch Ness Monster

deck: Scooby-Doo's eighth DTV animated film.
name: Aloha, Scooby-Doo!

deck: Scooby-Doo's ninth DTV animated film.
name: Scooby-Doo! in Where's My Mummy?

deck: The tenth Scooby-Doo animated DTV.
name: Scooby-Doo! Pirates Ahoy!

deck: Scooby-Doo's eleventh DTV animated film.
name: Chill Out, Scooby-Doo!

deck: Scooby-Doo's twelfth DTV animated film.
description: A clumsy faux magician steals the magic of a real fairy, but that's only the beginning of his plan to take over both the mortal and magic world.
name: Scooby-Doo! And the Goblin King

deck: Scooby-Doo's thirteenth animated DTV film.
name: Scooby-Doo! And the Samurai Sword

deck: The ranch of Red Ryder and his aunt, The Duchess, is being used as the training site for "Gentleman Jim" Corbett for his upcoming fight when a gang kidnaps him.
name: Vigilantes of Boomtown

deck: Again with the rustlers already!
name: The Fighting Redhead

deck: Trying to settle down on his aunt's ranch after the Spanish-American War Red and his pals Little Beaver & Blizard first have to deal with rustlers.
name: Rustlers of Devil's Canyon

deck: Scooby-Doo's fourteenth animated DTV film.
name: Scooby-Doo! Abracadabra-Doo

deck: Scooby-Doo's fifteenth animated DTV film.
description: The gang sign up as camp counselors at Camp Little Moose, a place where the creatures of scary camp stories seem to come to life.
name: Scooby-Doo! Camp Scare

deck: Scooby-Doo's third live-action film, and prequel to the first two.
name: Scooby-Doo! The Mystery Begins

deck: Scooby-Doo's fourth live-action film.
name: Scooby-Doo! Curse of the Lake Monster

deck: A one-hour special made to celebrate Pokemon's 10th anniversary.
name: Pokémon: The Mastermind of Mirage Pokémon

deck: The first Pokemon TV movie.
name: Pokémon: Mewtwo Returns

deck: An animated film based off the Final Fantasy video game series.
name: Final Fantasy: The Spirits Within

deck: A Pokemon TV animated movie. In North America, it was divided into three episodes.
name: Pokémon: The Legend of Thunder!

deck: Green Lantern: Emerald Knights is an DC Universe Animated Original Movie that weaves six interlocking stories of the Green Lantern Corps’ rich mythology around preparations for an attack by an ancient enemy. As the battle approaches, Hal Jordan mentors new recruit Arisia in the history of the Green Lantern Corps, telling tales of Avra (the first Green Lantern) and several of Hal’s comrades – including Abin Sur, Kilowog, Laira and Mogo. In the end, Arisia must rise to the occasion to help Hal, Sinestro and t
description:
Plot and Video

In time for the release of Green Lantern the movie comes Green Lantern: Emerald Knights. This original DC animated movie follows the story of Arisia, as she is recruited into the Green Lantern Corps and must face he return threat of Krona. A former Guardian who is out to destroy OA and all of creation. Hal Jordan and Kilowog are given the assignment of teaching the young rookie what it means to be a Green Lantern. As she flies through her training, she discovers the origins of several Green Lanterns including: Abin Sur, Kilowog, Laira, Mogo and Hal Jordan. The story unfolds in an uneven time line explaining the origns and return of Krona, the fall of Sinestro, the budding romance between Arisia and Hal Jordan and the coming of the Sinestro and Red Lantern Corps. Plus, the greatest bounty hunter in the known sectors, Bolphunga the Unrelenting attacking the Green Lanterns at every turn.
name: Green Lantern Emerald Knights

deck: French-Canadian Made for TV movie-series based on the popular Franco-Belgian Comic Book "XIII". Starring Val Kilmer and Stephen Dorff.
name: XIII: The Conspiracy

deck: An anime film based on the Eureka Seven manga and anime franchise, this film is an alternate re-telling.
name: Eureka Seven: Good Night, Sleep Tight, Young Lovers

deck: A live action Adaptation of Go Nagai's Manga.
name: Cutie Honey

deck: Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Lightning, Thief (also called Percy Jackson & The Lightning Thief) is a 2010 fantasy-adventure film directed by Chris Columbus. The film is loosely based on The Lightning Thief, the first novel in the Percy Jackson & The Olympians series by Rick Riordan. It stars Logan Lerman as Percy Jackson alongside an ensemble cast that includes Brandon T. Jackson, Alexandra Daddario, Jake Abel, Rosario Dawson, Steve Coogan, Uma Thurman, Catherine Keener, Kevin McKidd, Sean
description:
Column Head 1Column Head 2

Track Listings

1. Prelude, 2. The Minotaur , 3. Chiron , 4. Victory, 5. The Fury, 6. Dyslexia,7. The Hydra, 8. Medusa, 9. Son of Poseidon, 10. The Parthenon, 11. Hollywood, 12. Lost Souls, 13. Fighting Luke, Part 1, 14. Fighting Luke, Part 2, 15. Hades, 16. Mount Olympus
17. Poseidon
18. Homecoming
19. End Credits
name: Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Lightning Thief

deck: The first Fullmetal Alchemist anime film, this film was based on the first television series.
name: Fullmetal Alchemist the Movie: Conqueror of Shamballa

deck: The first live-action film based off the Guyver manga and anime series.
name: The Guyver

deck: The second live-action Guyver film, and the sequel to the first.
name: Guyver: Dark Hero

deck: A live-action film based on the long-running manga series of the same name.
name: Initial D

deck: In a violent city, the police have the authority to act as judge, jury and executioner.
description:
Somewhere off the eastern coast of America lies Mega City One, a vast violent metropolis, built on the ruins of the old world, where criminals rule the chaotic streets.

The only force of order lies with the Judges, a futuristic police force who possess the combined powers of judge, jury and executioner. Known and feared throughout the city, Dredd is the ultimate Judge, tasked with ridding the city of its latest scourge, a dangerous drug epidemic that has users of 'Slo-Mo' experiencing reality at a fraction of its normal speed.

Dredd is assigned to train and evaluate Cassandra Anderson, a rookie with powerful psychic abilities due to a genetic mutation. A heinous crime calls them to a neighborhood where fellow Judges rarely dare to venture, a 200-story vertical slum controlled by prostitute-turned-drug lord, Ma-Ma, and her ruthless clan.

When they capture one of the clan's inner circle, Ma-Ma overtakes the compound's control center and wages a brutal, vicious war against the Judges, stopping at nothing to protect her empire. With the body count climbing and no way out, Dredd and Anderson must confront the odds and engage in a relentless battle for their survival.

Official Synopsis

"DREDD takes us to the wild streets of Mega City One, the lone oasis of quasi-civilization on Cursed Earth. Judge Dredd (Karl Urban) is the most feared of elite Street Judges, with the power to enforce the law, sentence offenders and execute them on the spot – if necessary. The endlessly inventive mind of writer Alex Garland and the frenetic vision of director Peter Travis bring DREDD to life as a futuristic neo-noir action film that returns the celebrated character to the dark, visceral incarnation from John Wagner and Carlos Ezquerra’s revered comic strip."
name: Dredd

deck: The movie adaptation of the classic video game series, Doom.
description: A frantic call for help from a remote research station on Mars sends a team of mercenary Marines into action. Led by Gunnery Sergeant Asher "Sarge" Mahonin (The Rock) and Staff Sergeant John "Reaper" Grimm (Karl Urban), they descend into the Olduvai Research Station, where they find a legion of nightmarish creatures, lurking in the darkness, killing at will. Once there, the Marines must use an arsenal of firepower to carry out their mission: nothing gets out alive. Based on the hugely popular video game, DOOM is an explosive action-packed thrill ride!
name: Doom

deck: Six months after the rage virus was inflicted on the population of Great Britain, the US Army helps to secure a small area of London for the survivors to repopulate and start again. But not everything goes to plan.
name: 28: Weeks Later

deck: Conan reboot.
name: Conan the Barbarian

deck: Live action adaptation of Hiroya Oku's Sci-Fi/Thriller Gantz.
name: Gantz

deck: Wonder Woman's first appearance in live-action television was a TV movie made in 1974 for ABC, a pilot for an unmade series.
name: Wonder Woman

deck: After surviving the incidents in Barrow, Alaska, Stella Olemaun relocates to Los Angeles, where she intentionally attracts the attention of the local vampire population in order to avenge the death of her husband, Eben.
name: 30 Days of Night: Dark Days

deck: Based on the novel by Tiziano Sclavi.
name: Dellamorte Dellamore

deck: First part of two  Turkish film adaptions of Italy's famous comic hero, Zagor.
name: Zagor

deck: No guards, no walls.
name: No Escape

deck: After returning to california, Sidney Prescott, the daughter of the victim, seeks the truth about her Mother's life.
name: Scream 3

deck: Another serial killer taking the identity of Ghostface to seek victim's daughter and her friends at college in Ohio.
name: Scream 2

deck: A serial killer seeks the victim's daughter in California.
name: Scream

deck: The Saga's biggest fans on the galaxy's greatest mission to steal the first star wars film from George lucas's ranch.
name: Fanboys

deck: A police scientist developed a formula that could give him superspeed.
name: Stan Lee's Lightspeed

deck: The Reboot of the famous series, Planet of the Apes. Loosely based on the premise of Conquest of the Planet of the Apes, making it a "re-imagining" of the 1972 sequel.
description:
Overview

This film is a reboot of the famous series, Planet of the Apes. And while a reboot it also could be in the original's universe if you remove the last 2 movies. The movie was directed by Rupert Wyatt with actor Andy Serkis playing the ape, Caesar hero of the story

This movie also is known for being the greatest special effects film to date.
name: Rise of the Planet of the Apes

deck: Thun’da, now just in a regular jungle and not the Lost Land, is called on by his former bosses in the Air Force to find some missing top-secret microfilm.
name: King of the Congo

deck: The last dragon and a disillusioned dragonslaying knight must cooperate to stop an evil king who was given partial immortality.
name: Dragonheart

deck: An adventurous girl, a young blind hermit and a goofy two headed dragon race to find the lost sword Excalibur to save King Arthur and Camelot
description: In the days of King Arthur's Camelot, a renegade knight Ruber plots to usurp the throne by turning his henchmen into formidable monsters, forcing the widow of a Round Table knight he killed to use her privileged access to the King's castle and, most importantly, stealing King Arthur's symbol of power, the magical sword, Excalibur. When she kidnaps the widow, her young rambunctious daughter, Kayley, who dreams the seemingly impossible dream of becoming a Knight, escapes to both warn the King and try to recover Excalibur. Along the way, she meets up with a young blind hermit, a goofy two headed dragon and a mysterious silver winged falcon and together, they endeavor to find the sword to save the kingdom.
name: Quest for Camelot

deck: The last singing cowboy movie.... something to do with a horse.
name: The Phantom Stallion

deck: When a village is besieged by giant caterpillars, a more horrifying discovery is made in their underground home...a giant flying creature that resembles the prehistoric pterodactyl. Soon after, another one appears and the two monsters begin to destroy Japan.
name: Rodan

deck: A gigantic moth worshiped as a goddess by the islanders, seeks to find two kidnapped women (who are a foot high) from the island in Tokyo, wreaking havoc and destruction.
name: Mothra

deck: The tale of two slackers looking to avoid getting real jobs by creating a superhero team and getting it funded with a government grant. They then must recruit real superheroes to join their group in order to maintain the appearance of a legitimate team.
name: Suburban Heroes

deck: Animated adaptation based upon Frank Miller's 1987 story arc. The movie centers around Batman and Jim Gordon's first year of working to free Gotham City of crime.
description:
Commentary and first trailer

A preview for the movie was released on the movie for Green Lantern Emerald Knights. Bruce Timm, Andrea Romano and other talked about Batman Year One being the darkest film they've created to this date. The movie will focus on Batman's beginning days at trying to rid Gotham City of crime.

Overview

Centering around Bruce Wayne's first days as the caped crusader, Batman is marked an outlaw by the city he is trying to protect. While doing good, but running from the law, Batman will have to survive the night, or be only remembered as a dream. Based on Frank Miller's story Batman: Year One. The movie was released on October 18, and was able to be downloaded (digitally) on iTunes, Xbox Live Marketplace, Netflix, Playstation Video Store, among others.
name: Batman: Year One

deck: A security guard's dreams come true when he is selected to be transformed into a cybernetic police officer.
name: Inspector Gadget

deck: In the Valley of Peace, Po the Panda finds himself chosen as the Dragon Warrior despite the fact that he is obese and a complete novice at martial arts.
description:
Official Synopsis

"Enthusiastic, big and a little clumsy, Po is the biggest fan of kung fu around…which doesn’t exactly come in handy while working every day in his family’s noodle shop. Unexpectedly chosen to fulfill an ancient prophecy, Po’s dreams become reality when he joins the world of kung fu and studies alongside his idols, the legendary Furious Five—Tigress, Crane, Mantis, Viper and Monkey—under the leadership of their guru, Master Shifu. But before they know it, the vengeful and treacherous snow leopard Tai Lung is headed their way, and it’s up to Po to defend everyone from the oncoming threat. Can he turn his dreams of becoming a kung fu master into reality? Po puts his heart — and his girth —into the task, and the unlikely hero ultimately finds that his greatest weaknesses turn out to be his greatest strengths."
name: Kung Fu Panda

deck: Johnny Blaze tries to find a purpose to his condition. This is his darker tale as a Ghost Rider. It's considered to be more of a reboot than a sequel.
description: "Nicolas Cage returns as Johnny Blaze in GHOST RIDER™ SPIRIT OF VENGEANCE. Still struggling with his curse as the devil's bounty hunter, Johnny is hiding out in a remote part of Europe when he is recruited by a secret sect of the church to save a young boy from the devil. At first, Johnny is reluctant to embrace the power of the Ghost Rider, but it is the only way to protect the boy and possibly rid himself of his curse forever."
name: Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance

deck: A policewoman, her quarry and an innocent delivery boy become trapped in a haunted toy warehouse.
name: Demonic Toys

deck: A group of toymakers seek to use Andre Toulon's formula, now in the hands of Toulon's great-nephew Robert, to give life to a line of killer toys that they plan to unleash on Christmas Eve.
name: Puppet Master vs Demonic Toys

deck: The cop Judith Grey teams with Brick Bardo (Dollman) and his girlfriend Ginger to face once again the evil Demonic Toys for one final battle.
name: Dollman vs. Demonic Toys

deck: A group of people on a world wide search for oddities find themselves trapped in a nine hundred year old Italian castle when they accident unleash the Demonic Toys.
name: Demonic Toys: Personal Demons

deck: Film based on the Korean comic book series Priest.
description: In a dystopian future, where warrior-priests have all but eradicated a global vampire infestation, one priest defies the church and leaves the safety of the walled city to venture into the wastelands because he believes a girl was kidnapped by surviving vampires.
name: Priest

deck: Winnie The Pooh bear and his friends return on the big screen going on fun adventures in the Hundred Acre Wood.
name: Winnie The Pooh

deck: A three act low budget, high quality film written during the Writers Strike.
name: Dr. Horrible’s Sing-Along Blog

deck:
The animated movie from Hearst Entertainment, Inc./ King Features Syndicate, Inc.is based on the popular television series, Phantom 2040. 
In the year 2040, the fate of the planet depends on the intelligence and courage of the young Kit Walker who is now the Phantom in the year 2040. He must battle the evil and destructive Rebecca Madison who plans to destroy all of the earth's resources. The Phantom can stop her only be the way through virtual worlds and "remote brains".
name: Phantom 2040 Movie: The Ghost Who Walks

deck: Luc Besson's live-action adaptation of Jacques Tardi's famous graphic novel series revolving around the many adventures of the novelist turned investigative journalist Adele Blanc-Sec.
name: Les Aventures extraordinaires d'Adèle Blanc-Sec

deck: Also known as 'The Adventures of Tintin:The Secret of the Unicorn.' A 2011 animated film based on the Tintin comic books, combining three of the kid reporter's adventures into one film directed by Steven Spielberg.
description: The Adventures of Tintin is based off of 'The Secret of the Unicorn,' 'Red Rackham's Treasure' and 'The Crab with the Golden Claws' by Hergé. Originally planned as a live-action film (with Snowy the only CG-character) back in 2004, the switch was eventually made to complete CG.
name: The Adventures of Tintin

deck: Professor Calculus is sent strange blue oranges in the mail and before they have the chance to puzzle over them an intruder tries to steal them. Realizing they are valuable, they head off to Valencia where Professor Calculus recalls a colleague was working on something similar.
name: Tintin and the Blue Oranges

deck: Captain Haddock inherits a great ship in Istanbul but is despondent to find it's an old wreck. But when he refuses to sell it to a stranger for a hefty sum and is nearly killed for doing so, he and Tintin realize that it's a clue to a great treasure.
name: Tintin and the Mystery of the Golden Fleece
Tintin and the Lake of Sharks

deck: Seven archaeologists discover an ancient Inca temple and one by one they fall victim to a curse which puts them in a deep sleep. While the sixth one succumbs to the curse at Tintin's house, professor Calculus is captured and it's up to Tintin and Haddock to rescue him.
name: Tintin and the Temple of the Sun

deck: Lightning McQueen and Mater travel the world for the World Grand Prix, but end up getting sucked into the world of espionage!
description: "Star racecar Lightning McQueen and the incomparable tow truck Mater take their friendship to exciting new places in ‘Cars 2′ when they head overseas to compete in the first-ever World Grand Prix to determine the world’s fastest car. But the road to the championship is filled with plenty of potholes, detours and hilarious surprises when Mater gets caught up in an intriguing adventure of his own: international espionage. Torn between assisting Lightning McQueen in the high-profile race and towing the line in a top-secret spy mission, Mater’s action-packed journey leads him on an explosive chase through the streets of Japan and Europe, trailed by his friends and watched by the whole world. Adding to the fast-paced fun is a colorful new all-car cast that includes secret agents, menacing villains and international racing competitors."
name: Cars 2

deck: The Wolverine(2013) stars Hugh Jackman as  the Wolverine in his second solo film.
description:
"Based on the celebrated comic book arc, this epic action-adventure takes Wolverine, the most iconic character of the X-Men universe, to modern day Japan. Out of his depth in an unknown world he faces his ultimate nemesis in a life-or-death battle that will leave him forever changed. Vulnerable for the first time and pushed to his physical and emotional limits, he confronts not only lethal samurai steel but also his inner struggle against his own immortality, emerging more powerful than we have ever seen him before."

Development

It will be produced by Lauren Shuler Donner and Marvel, and Hugh Jackman is slated to return for the sequel. Hood speculated that there will be a sequel, which will be set in Japan. During one of the end credits scenes Logan is seen drinking at a bar in Japan. Such a location was the subject of Claremont and Miller's series, which was not in the first film as Jackman felt "what we need to do is establish who "Logan" is and find out how he became Wolverine". Jackman stated the Claremont-Miller series is his favorite Wolverine story. Of the Japanese arc, Jackman also stated that: “..there are so many areas of that Japanese story, I love the idea of this kind of anarchic character, the outsider, being in this world - I can see it aesthetically, too - full of honor and tradition and customs and someone who’s really anti-all of that, and trying to negotiate his way. The idea of the samurai, too - and the tradition there. It’s really great. In the comic book he gets his ass kicked by a couple of samurai - not even mutants. He’s shocked by that at first.” Jackman added that another Wolverine film would be a follow-up rather than continuing on from X-Men: The Last Stand. The inclusion of Deadpool and Gambit also leads to the possibilities of their own spin-offs. Before Wolverine's release, Lauren Shuler Donner approached Simon Beaufoy to write the script, but he did not feel confident enough to commit. On May 5, just two days after its initial weekend run, the sequel was officially confirmed. Christopher McQuarrie, who went uncredited for his work on X-Men, was hired to write the screenplay for the Wolverine sequel in August 2009. Darren Aronofsky was announced as director of the film but had relinquished his position to spend time with his family.
name: The Wolverine

deck: John Carter one day miraculously transported to the planet Mars, where he learns of his destiny to save the dying planet from War between two races and its leaders, Tars Tarkas and Princess Dejah Thoris.
name: John Carter

deck: Highlander: The Adventure Begins is based on the Highlander animated series. The story follows a young Immortal named Quentin MacLeod who has to defeat an evil Immortal, Kortan from conquering Earth in the distant future.
name: Highlander: The Adventure Begins

deck: Seven stories from the heart of the Halo Universe
name: Halo Legends

deck: Helen of Troy is a 2003 mini-series, often viewed as a single film.
description:
The mini-series attempts to cover the life story of Paris and Helen from their earlier days to the end of the Trojan War. The film begins with the birth of Paris and the prophecy Cassandra makes about her brother. Then switches to Sparta and the abduction of Helen by Theseus, preceeding her marriage to Menelaus. The film continues telling the tale until the death of Agamemnon.  
 
The film covers several aspects of the Trojan War legends but offers some original takes on the psychologies of the figures involved. Unusualy, Agamemnon himself is depicted lusting after Helen.
name: Helen of Troy

deck: Saint Seiya: Legend of Crimson Youth is a 1988 anime film. It was the third theatrically released film in this series, but the first to be actually feature-long.
description: Phoebus Abel arrives on Earth and visits his sister Saori Kido (Athena). He brings along his own warriors and reveals his true agenda. To wipe out humanity in a series of disasters, as punishment for their greed and crimes against nature. Athena plays along for a while. But she and her warriors have to find a way to save the human race from a "cleansing" operation.
name: Saint Seiya: Legend of Crimson Youth

deck: Hercules in New York is a 1969 fantasy comedy, best remembered for the first starring role of Arnold Schwarzenegger.
description:
Bored in the palaces of Olympus, Hercules wishes for one more adventure on Earth. Zeus doesn't wish his son to leave. But angrily allows him to. Hercules finds himself in modern day New York City and tries finding a place in the world surrounding him. Starting a wrestling career, befriending skinny little guy Pretzie (Arnold Stang) and romancing pretty girl Helen Camden (Deborah Loomis). Much of the humor derives from the culture clash between the ancient hero and 1960s-style life.

But a conspiracy between Hera, Hades and Nemesis plan of stripping Hercules of his powers and immortality. Hercules has to find a way out of this mess.

Note: At some point Zeus sends Atlas and Samson to help Hercules. Atlas is a character of Greek legend. But Samson is part of Hebrew legend.
name: Hercules in New York

deck: Vulcan, Son of Jupiter is 1962 film, an example of the Italian sword-and-sandal genre.
description:
The film begins with a love triangle on Olympus. Vulcan and Mars fight over nymphomaniac Venus. Breaking certain rules of contact. Both Gods are punished with their powers diminished and a temporary exile to Earth. But they have no intention of spending their time in contemplation and repentance.

The devious Mars sets camp at the court of Thrace and Venus soon follows him. The two scheme to start a rebellion of the Thracians against Jupiter. Meanwhile, Vulcan has trouble with Pluto taking a chance at tormenting him. He is rescued by Etna (Bella Cortez) and soon falls for her. Our heroic couple soon stand in they way of the villainous couple. The quarrel of the Gods is quickly leading to a war on Earth, involving several mortal tribes.

The film shares many of the positive and negative elements of its genre. The special effects were crude, the characterizations shallow and the plot aims for excitement and not depth or subtlety. But there are plenty of moments of comic-book style action, the fantastic elements are thoroughly entertaining, and the lead actors and actresses serve as eye candy.
name: Vulcan, Son of Jupiter

deck: The Fiendish Plot of Fu Manchu is a 1980 comedy, a comedic look at the eternal conflict between Fu Manchu and Nayland Smith.
description:
Fu Manchu is currently 168-years-old and due to the goof of an employee no longer has access to his elixir vitae (elixir of life), the formula which prolongs his life. His plot aims at recreating the elixir and once again escaping death. Nayland Smith has aged, retired from active service. Several years of enduring his opponent's tortures and machinations have left him slightly unhinged. But he is recalled on duty to face the Doctor's latest plan.

The film derives much of its humor from both opponents being way past their prime. However it was poorly received due to poor plotting. Helen Mirren stands out as police constable Alice Rage. She starts out as Smith's new partner but switches sides when Fu Manchu seduces her.
name: The Fiendish Plot of Fu Manchu

deck: The Vengeance of Fu Manchu is a 1967 British-German co-production. Fu Manchu targets his archenemy Nayland Smith.
name: The Vengeance of Fu-Manchu

deck: Daughter of the Dragon is a 1931 entry in the Fu Manchu series. Fu Manchu seeks vengeance on the Petrie family, holding them responsible for the deaths of his wife and daughter.
description:
The film contains elements related to the novel "The Daughter of Fu Manchu" (1931), a major appearance of Fah Lo Suee. But the production company had not licenced the character and could not use it. Instead the female lead is Princess Ling Moy (Anna May Wong), an illegitimate daughter of Fu.

Today the film is better known for Wong's first major role in a "talkie" (sound film).

The film does not depict Nayland Smith. Instead Fu's opponent is fellow Asian Ah Kee (Sessue Hayakawa).
name: Daughter of the Dragon

deck: The Return of Dr. Fu Manchu is a 1930 entry in the Fu Manchu series. The supposedly deceased Doctor returns to action.
description: The film is a loose adaptation of the novel "The Devil Doctor" (1916).
name: The Return of Dr. Fu Manchu

deck: Mr. and Mrs. Bennet have five unmarried daughters, and Mrs. Bennet is especially eager to find suitable husbands for them. When the rich single gentlemen Mr. Bingley and Mr. Darcy come to live nearby, the Bennets have high hopes, however pride, prejudice, and misunderstandings all combine to complicate their relationships and to make happiness difficult.
name: Pride and Prejudice

deck: Sparks fly when spirited Elizabeth Bennett meets single, rich, and proud Mr. Darcy. But Mr. Darcy reluctantly finds himself falling in love with a woman beneath his class. Can each overcome their own pride and prejudice?
name: Pride and Prejudice

deck: The first movie adaption of Cartoon Network's Ben 10.
description: The first live action Ben 10 film.
name: Ben 10: Race Against Time

deck: The second movie adaption of Cartoon Network's Ben 10.
name: Ben 10: Alien Swarm

deck: Reboot of the Superman movie franchise and the beginning of the DC Extended Universe, with Henry Cavill as the man of steel. Directed by Zack Snyder, of 300 and Watchmen fame. Written by David Goyer and Christopher Nolan, director of The Dark Knight Trilogy.
description:
Official Synopsis

In the pantheon of superheroes, Superman is the most recognized and revered character of all time. Clark Kent/Kal-El (Cavill) is a young twenty something journalist who feels alienated by powers beyond anyone’s imagination. Transported to Earth years ago from Krypton, an advanced alien planet, Clark struggles with the ultimate question – Why am I here? Shaped by the values of his adoptive parents Martha (Lane) and Jonathan Kent (Costner), Clark soon discovers that having super abilities means making very difficult decisions. But when the world needs stability the most, it comes under attack. Will his abilities be used to maintain peace or ultimately used to divide and conquer? Clark must become the hero known as “Superman,” not only to shine as the world’s last beacon of hope but to protect the ones he loves.

Henry Cavill has been quoted saying that to prepare for the role he read " Birthright", "Red Sun" and "The Death and Return Of Superman".

In the Jor-El voice over teaser trailer, Russel Crowe is reciting a line from Grant Morrison's All-Star Superman.

Hans Zimmer was named to score the film in June 2012.

On January 23rd 2013, the MPAA gave "MAN oF STEEL [2013]" a rating of PG-13 "for intense sequences of sci-fi violence, action and destruction, and for some language."

As of Feb. 19. 2013, iMDB is listing "Man of Steel" with a run time of 148 minutes. This is approximately 8 minutes longer than Batman Begins and 4.5 minutes shorter than The Dark Knight.
name: Man of Steel

deck: Animated science fiction adaptation of Stevenson's novel Treasure Island produced by Walt Disney Animation Studios.
description:
The film opens on a young Jim Hawkins (Joseph Gordon-Levitt), reading a holographic book on the space pirate, Captain Nathaniel Flint who stores his booty on the legendary "Treasure Planet."

Jim is now a rebellious 15 year-old, with a knack for mechanics and engineering his own "solar surfers" (a sci-fi analog to wind surfing). One night, an old "spacer" (i.e. space sailor) named Billy Bones lands by the Hawkins family inn, but is in poor shape. He gives Jim a golden ball, a map to Captain Flint's treasure and warns Jim about a cyborg. Bones then dies and the inn is ransacked and burned by pirates as Jim and his mother escape with family friend, Doctor Delbert Doppler (David Hyde Pierce).

Doctor Doppler fiances a voyage to find Treasure Planet, hiring a ship and crew including Captain Amelia (Emma Thompson), her first mate Mr. Arrow (Roscoe Lee Browne), and the cyborg cook, Long John Silver (Brian Murray). Jim is assigned to be Silver's cabin boy; although initially suspicious of the cook (who is indeed a pirate captain in disguise), the two quickly form a strong bond. Silver becomes a father figure for Jim and helps Jim find purpose and meaning to what he does. However, when traversing space, the ship encounters many dangers. At one point, Jim is responsible for securing lifelines for the whole crew, which he does successfully, but Scroop (Michael Wincott), a sinister member of the crew and one of Silver's coherts, disposes of Mr. Arrow. Jim blames himself when the life line is missing. Silver knows that Scroop is responsible and tries to comfort Jim.

Soon they are in sight of Treasure Planet and the pirates plan to mutiny. Silver, worried about seeming soft, also denounces his relationship with Jim as nothing. Jim overhears all of this and informs the captain. The mutiny begins and the captain, Dr. Doppler, and Jim flee to the planet surface. While there, Jim finds a robot named B.E.N. (Martin Short), a member of Flint's crew left there because he knows (but has forgotten) the secrets of the planet. The Captain and Dr. Doppler are captured by Silver and the pirates, so Jim agrees to lead the pirates to the treasure. They find a portal that can open to any corner of the universe, including the interior of the planet where the treasure is hidden. However, the crew sets off a booby trap that begins to destroy the planet. Dr. Doppler and the Captain retake the ship, and Silver saves Jim, sacrificing the treasure he had been searching for. Jim, Silver, the Doppler, and the Captain use the portal to escape the exploding planet. Silver, then flees to avoid jail, with Jim's blessing. Silver leaves Jim a handful of treasure to rebuild the family inn.

Captain Amelia recommends Jim to the Interstellar Academy; in the epilogue the inn is rebuilt and Jim has matured in an upstanding young man.
name: Treasure Planet

deck: Holmes and Watson are facing their toughest trial yet, an adversary of epic proportions: Professor Moriarty!
name: Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows

deck: The ever populair Belgian comic book duo Suske & Wiske go to the movie screen with the story of the 'Texas Rakkers'.
description: The story was originally presented in Suske & Wiske #37 - De Texas-Rakkers.
name: Suske en Wiske & De Texas Rakkers

deck: The movie adaptation of SNK's classic fighting game. The movie revolves around Terry and Andy Bogard's quest to avenge their fathers death at the hands of Geese Howard.
name: Fatal Fury: Legend of the Hungry Wolf

deck: The second movie for Fatal Fury where Terry Bogard must fight Wolfgang Krauser, the half brother of Geese Howard.
name: Fatal Fury 2: The New Battle

deck: An orignal storyline featuring the Fatal Fury Team of Terry Bogard, Andy Bogard, Joe Higashi, and their friends.
name: Fatal Fury: The Motion Picture

deck: After breaking up a robbery Ryo Sakazaki and Robert Garcia are brought into a mobsters game when he kidnaps Ryo's younger sister Yuri.
description: While looking for a cat, Ryo and Robert (two karate experts) witnessed a murder related to a stolen diamond. After fighting the murdering mobsters, they discovered that the top mobster, Mr. Big, had kidnapped Ryo's sister to exchange her against the diamond, which he believes to be in the possession of the protagonists. They then have to defend themselves anyway they can - mainly through kicks and punches. They both attempt to break into Big's hideout to save Yuri but their plans are foiled by the sudden arrival of the police force. Forced with no other options, they spend the night searching for the diamond. When they find it, they go to meet Big and give it to him. A big fight ensues, complete with an exploding helicopter and a bout with King and Big, but they are able to save Yuri and head back home. Ryuhaku and the police force arrest Big and his men. They also confiscate the diamond, which is somewhere at the bottom of Big's pool.
name: Art of Fighting
